Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

The 'open new tab' button (+) has 3 sides to it (top, left and right) and on mouseover this look remains the same except for the fact the the colour changes. However, if sufficient tabs are open (so that the tab scroll buttons appear), then the open new tab button surround disappears and when you hover your mouse over it, only the left and right sides of the button appear (the top is missing). The same happens when hovering your mouse over the the tab scroll buttons (the side of the buttons appear, but the top is cut off and missing).

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have only one tab open and then hover your mouse over the "Open New tab" button. Observe what the button looks like.
2. Open enough tabs so that the < > tab scroll buttons appear.
3. Hover your mouse over each tab scroll button and observe the button's appearance.
4. Hover your mouse over the "open a new tab" button and observe its appearance. Compare to the mouseover appearance when only one tab was open.
Actual Results:  
The top of the tab scroll button is not visible even though the sides of the button is visible. The same applies to the open new tab button (i.e. the sides of the button appear on mouseover, but the top of the button is missing).

Expected Results:  
The entire button surround (all 3 sides) should appear on mouseover (left, right AND top)

The "group your tabs" button appears to be afflicted with the same problem described above (i.e. it has no top to the button edge on mouseover) however in that particular case the problem is always present regardless of how many tabs are open.

Just also noticed a couple of things:

1. If you move the "group your tabs" button from the tab bar to the menu toolbar, the button appears with a button border on all 4 sides when you hover your mouse over it (which is just as it should be when it's in that position) so the problem is to do with how button edges are handled when the button is on the same bar as the browser tabs.

2. If you move the Open New Tab (+) button to the left of the tab bar, it loses it's 3 side button background that it has when it's on the right hand side of the tab bar, and on mouseover you get the same broken button edge (i.e. top of button is missing).
